title: How many words in the English language do you know that are pronounced the same way, but are spelled differently and have a different meaning? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi, Too, two, to. Bo, as in staff, bow as in bend forward, bow as that of a ship, bow as a bow and arrow. BATas in ball and bat, and BATman. The Sahara DESERT, to DESERT a person (and dessert after dinner). A country FAIR and a FAIR maiden, FAIR DEAL REFUSE an offer and throw away REFUSE (garbage) And the king of all is FINE, especially when a woman said that to you.

What you are referring to is one of the definitions of a homonym. There are many homonyms in the English language; it’s one of the reasons why it’s so difficult to learn for those who learn it as a second language. Here are some off the top of my head: They’re/Their/ThereYour/You’reMorning/Mourning (some pronounce these slightly differently)Read/RedBeat/BeetPeace/PiecePeak/Peek
